TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit RegistrationErrorInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Retrieves extended error information about methods related to multiple COM+ objects. This also includes methods that install, import, and export COM+ applications and components. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to retrieve extended error information about methods related to multiple COM+ objects.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices Registration#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_9_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices Registration#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_9_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices Registration#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_9_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the error code for the object or file.
Docs.value: The error code for the object or file.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to retrieve the error string from a `RegistrationErrorInfo` object.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices Registration#4](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.enterpriseservi_28_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices Registration#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.enterpriseservi_28_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices Registration#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.enterpriseservi_28_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the key value for the object that caused the error, if applicable.
Docs.value: The key value for the object that caused the error, if applicable.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the key value does not apply, MajorRef is the same as <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.RegistrationErrorInfo.Name%2A>. Use this to look at the item that failed to update, or to find the component or DLL that failed to install.

Docs.summary: Gets a precise specification of the item that caused the error, such as a property name.
Docs.value: A precise specification of the item, such as a property name, that caused the error. If multiple errors occurred, or this does not apply, MinorRef returns the string "<Invalid>".

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the object or file that caused the error.
Docs.value: The name of the object or file that caused the error.
